A **rabid rabbit**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a a faster and more dangerous variant of the [rabbit](/wiki/Rabbit "Rabbit"), which it shares a glyph with. In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits can be made [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") with [carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot"), while in Hack'EM they cannot be tamed at all.

A rabid rabbit has a [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution")-draining bite similar to the [rabid rat](/wiki/Rabid_rat "Rabid rat"); in SlashTHEM, it also possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Generation

Rabid rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

Rabid rabbits appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

## Strategy

The rabid rabbit's high movement speed and poisonous bite make them a very dangerous early encounter in all variants, and they should be brought down as quickly as possible with any means of [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") available if you lack poison resistance.

### SLASH'EM

Rabid rabbits do not have poison resistance like most monsters with poisonous attacks, providing further options for disposing of one. A poisoned edged weapon (e.g. using a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") or a [toilet](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet")) can kill one off quickly, and carrots can be used to tame them - tamed rabid rabbits can help with other early-game threats, and at minimum you will have one less threat of instant death to fear.

### SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits cannot be poisoned themselves, though other methods of handling them still apply.

### Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, rabid rabbits cannot be made tame to remove their threat, but also lack poison resistance.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Rabid rabbit

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r rabid rabbit
Difficulty 5
Attacks Bite 2d6 poison (drains constitution)
r rabid rabbit
Difficulty 5
Attacks

Bite 2d6 poison (drains constitution)

Base level 3
Base experience 31
Speed 18
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 20
Nutritional value 12
Size Tiny
Resistances poison resistance (SlashTHEM only)
Resistances conveyed None

A rabid rabbit:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1433

A rabid rabbit, r, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is a a faster and more dangerous variant of the rabbit, which it shares a glyph with. In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits can be made tame with carrots, while in Hack'EM they cannot be tamed at all.

A rabid rabbit has a poisonous, constitution-draining bite similar to the rabid rat; in SlashTHEM, it also possesses poison resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 SlashTHEM
    • 2.3 Hack'EM

Generation

Rabid rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in Gehennom.

Rabid rabbits appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Yeomen and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Yeoman quest.

Strategy

The rabid rabbit's high movement speed and poisonous bite make them a very dangerous early encounter in all variants, and they should be brought down as quickly as possible with any means of ranged attack available if you lack poison resistance.

SLASH'EM

Rabid rabbits do not have poison resistance like most monsters with poisonous attacks, providing further options for disposing of one. A poisoned edged weapon (e.g. using a potion of sickness or a toilet) can kill one off quickly, and carrots can be used to tame them - tamed rabid rabbits can help with other early-game threats, and at minimum you will have one less threat of instant death to fear.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits cannot be poisoned themselves, though other methods of handling them still apply.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, rabid rabbits cannot be made tame to remove their threat, but also lack poison resistance.

A '''rabid rabbit''', {{monsym|rabid rabbit}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a a faster and more dangerous variant of the [[rabbit]], which it shares a glyph with. In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits can be made [[tame]] with [[carrot]]s, while in Hack'EM they cannot be tamed at all.

A rabid rabbit has a [[poison]]ous, [[constitution]]-draining bite similar to the [[rabid rat]]; in SlashTHEM, it also possesses [[poison resistance]].

==Generation==
Rabid rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in [[Gehennom]].

Rabid rabbits appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Yeomen]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Yeoman quest]].

==Strategy==
The rabid rabbit's high movement speed and poisonous bite make them a very dangerous early encounter in all variants, and they should be brought down as quickly as possible with any means of [[ranged attack]] available if you lack poison resistance.

===SLASH'EM===
Rabid rabbits do not have poison resistance like most monsters with poisonous attacks, providing further options for disposing of one. A poisoned edged weapon (e.g. using a [[potion of sickness]] or a [[toilet]]) can kill one off quickly, and carrots can be used to tame them - tamed rabid rabbits can help with other early-game threats, and at minimum you will have one less threat of instant death to fear.

===SlashTHEM===
In SlashTHEM, rabid rabbits cannot be poisoned themselves, though other methods of handling them still apply.

===Hack'EM===
In Hack'EM, rabid rabbits cannot be made tame to remove their threat, but also lack poison resistance.
